oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bovine physical examination
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jones, Meredyth
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: exam
physical
bovine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The physical examination is the foundation of the diagnostic workup in cattle. The physical exam begins with a distance exam where the animal is observed prior to restraint where pa­rameters such as mental status, abdominal contour and lame­ness are best evaluated. With completion of the distance exam, the hands-on examination begins. It has been said that you miss more by not looking than by not knowing. For this reason, a systematic physical examination in which the examining veterinarian follows a standard pattern for every animal exam­ined is to be followed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 55 (2022): 2022 Annual Conference Proceedings; 93-95
